description.narrative: (i) Access to finance: The Project will increase the availability of financing to the underserved rural and agribusiness sectors, primarily small producers. (ii) Employment generation: The Project will contribute to the generation of new direct and indirect jobs through the scaling up of producers. (iii) Demonstration effect: IFC''s re-engagement with the sector together with the successful allocation of funding to rural agri producers is expected to motivate others to reactivate their support to the microfinance sector in Nicaragua, and increase/venture into the agribusiness sector.

The proposed project consists of a financing package of US$7 million to Fondo de Desarrollo Local (FDL, the Institution, or the client), the largest microfinance institution (MFI) in Nicaragua. The proposed project aims at supporting FDLs expansion plan, allowing the Institution to expand its on-lending in the rural agribusiness sector and micro-entrepreneurs in Nicaragua through its network of rural branches. The proposed financing package will be supported by the Private Sector Window of the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP). GAFSP funding plays a catalytic role to create opportunity to support innovative private sector investments and deliver a level of additionality and impact beyond what is possible through IFCs regular operations.
